data.title: GPT-logprobs
data.description: A web application that provides indicators and educational content for prompt creation, designed for those who lack confidence in the output of AI generation. Users can freely set parameters and improve the quality of prompts while reviewing the results.

data.title: NUTMEG-Seeds
data.description: A web application that shares technical knowledge within the organization 'NUTMEG' to which I belong. The theme color is orange, which is NUTMEG's image color, and the design is elaborate down to the smallest detail.

data.title: Group-manager-2
data.description: This web application is used when registering for the university festival at Nagaoka University of Technology. It excels in functionality such as PDF output and statistical data display, featuring a stylish black-based design.

data.title: Communication-AI
data.description: A web application that allows conversations with AI. Although the conversation system is simple, the design and accessibility are carefully considered, aiming to be used by a wide range of users.

data.title: Slack-message-finder
data.description: A web application that retrieves and saves Slack logs in real-time, displaying them on a Slack-like page. Features include the ability to view channel activity and track the weekly activities of specific users.

data.title: Menter-management-app
data.description: A web application that supports the mentor system. It links mentors and mentees and allows the viewing of mentee learning records. It is a simple web app managed by administrators.

data.title: Recognition Performance Validation of Weather Map Images by ChatGPT
data.authors: Yuki H. Takano, Shotaro Watanabe, Gendo Kumoi
data.abstract: Weather map recognition is a complex image recognition task that requires two cognitive processes: the interpretation of symbols and future predictions. Recent advancements in multimodal AI have shown the potential to solve such complex tasks. This study uses ChatGPT, a type of multimodal AI, to validate the recognition performance of weather map images and proposes prompt engineering for more accurate recognition. Weather map recognition is a problem that is also featured in the Common University Entrance Test. If weather maps can be recognized, automatic grading and question generation become possible, leading to learning support. Furthermore, it is expected that weather commentary text can be automatically generated from weather maps. Therefore, weather map image recognition is an important task, but it requires not only recognizing time-series changes in local weather data but also recognizing information on large-scale weather patterns such as pressure configurations and making future predictions. In this study, we use ChatGPT4-Vision, a multimodal AI, to validate the recognition performance of weather map images. We investigate whether it can answer questions about weather maps from university entrance exams and generate weather commentary text from weather map images. By conducting multiple experiments with varying tasks and information in the prompts, and evaluating the accuracy of the generated commentaries, we propose and validate improvements in reading performance through prompt engineering.

data.title: Verification of weather comment generation from weather map images using ChatGPT
data.authors: Yuki H. Takano, Shotaro Watanabe, Gendo Kumoi
data.abstract: Weather forecasts (weather comments) are created by meteorologists interpreting visualized information and converting it into language. Previous studies on automatic generation of weather comments have two challenges: including information on large-scale atmospheric fields and generating natural sentences. In this study, we use ChatGPT4-Vision, a multimodal AI, to automatically generate weather comments from surface weather map images. By conducting experiments that vary the tasks specified in the prompts and the amount of information provided, and verifying the accuracy of the output comments, we explore the applicability of multimodal AI to weather comment generation.
